interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information === Product Title: KIMUSE Lash Enhancing Serum, Castor Oil, Eyelash Growth Serum and Eyebrow Enhancer, Promotes Appearance of Longer, Thicker Eyelashes, Fuller Thicker Lashes & Brows (5ML), Cruelty Free (lash enhancing serum) Review Date: 2021/10/26 Store: KIMUSE Average Rating: 3.8 Product Details: {'Use for': 'Face', 'Scent': 'Aloe', 'Brand': 'KIMUSE', 'Unit Count': '1.00 Count', 'Product Dimensions': '5.5 x 0.86 x 0.86 inches; 1.13 Ounces', 'UPC': '887349696800'} Review Text: I’ve been trying out a couple of different lash serums over the past month. With my husband also using it (on his brows), while I use it on my lashes, we’ve been able to try different brands to see if there are any differences in results. This serum, by Kimuse, is very similar to the others in consistency (a thin liquid) and in how it’s applied (with a very thin brush). I have had no negative reactions to the serum, and no irritation to my eyes even when I’ve slipped and gotten some in my eye. This serum boasts results in as little as 3-4 weeks, while most others are more conservative at 6 weeks. In the few weeks we’ve been using the serums, neither of us have noticed any dramatic changes as far as lash or brow growth, but I do think I’m losing fewer lashes which is a definite plus. Honestly, I’m not sure if any serum is going to provide dramatic results, but we’ll continue for at least a few more weeks and see what happens while hoping for the best.Hopefully, I’ll be back with exciting news!

Update: After using this, as well as other, lash growth serums for several months, I have noticed a definite improvement in the length of my lashes. I have not noticed as significant an improvement in the thickness, or volume, of my lashes, however. I believe that these types of serums do help promote growth, and I haven't been able to detect much difference between brands except that a couple of them irritated my eyes. Therefore, my conclusion is that this is helpful and the real determination of what works best will be what's most comfortable for you to use, so read the ingredients and watch for any possible allergy triggers or irritants. Review Title: Patience required Rating: 4.0 --------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
Bath Tub Pillow Bathtub Pillows Headrest with Neck and Back Support, 4D Air Mesh Bath Accessories, 6 Strong Suction Cups, Hot Tub, Jacuzzi Home Spa for Women Men Apriluna {'Brand': 'Apriluna', 'Material': 'Foam, Mesh', 'Product Care Instructions': 'Hand Wash Only', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'Package Dimensions': '15.75 x 7.95 x 5.55 inches; 15.24 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'BP4D', 'Manufacturer': 'Apriluna'} This pillow is soft and comfy and makes for a relaxing bath. I love the soft fabric that covers the pillow, such an improvement over the plastic pillow I had been using. With six suction cups, it stays in place in my free-standing tub, and it’s just the right size to cradle my head and also cushion my upper back. There is an attached hook to hang the pillow to dry when done bathing. Included with the pillow are a tool to loosen the suction cups from the tub, a storage bag, and a bag of rose petals for your first bath with the new pillow. A very nice pillow! Soft and comfortable Kea Health Manuka Honey Moisturizer Cream - For Cracked Hands and Feet - Eczema and Psoriasis Treatment - Anti Itch Relief for Dry Skin - With Lanolin and Olive Oil Kea Health {'Brand': 'Kea Health', 'Item Form': 'Cream', 'Unit Count': '7.0 Ounce', 'Number of Items': '1', 'Use for': 'Hands, Feet', 'Package Dimensions': '2.95 x 2.91 x 2.72 inches; 8.15 Ounces'} This is a thick, rich cream that, for me, has worked wonders on dry, scaly skin. My hands needed some serious help and after using this cream for just a few days, I have seen much improvement. My skin is much soft, the cracks are disappearing, and they feel moisturized. The cream is thick, a little goes a long way, and I’ve found it’s best to really rub it in, not list skim it over the skin and leave it. I have also been using the cream on a particularly itchy patch of skin on my back, again, with excellent results.
There is no scent.
The cream is made from several natural ingredients, most notably Manuka honey from New Zealand, something new to me, but that has been used for centuries in New Zealand. I’m glad it made its way to me in the USA! Wonderful! Squalane + Cucumber Rapid Eye Lift Cream for Dark Circles and Puffiness, Peptide-Complex Infused - 0.4 oz Skin Set Go {'Brand': 'Skin Set Go', 'Item Form': 'Cream', 'Number of Items': '1', 'Use for': 'Eyes', 'Item Volume': '0.4 Fluid Ounces'} When I opened this package, I had no idea what I was looking at. Inside the Amazon packaging bag was another bag, a plastic bag with a bubble wrap lining and a ziplock type zipper. Inside that, was what looked like a syringe. Honestly, I was at first convinced I had the wrong order as I had no recollection of ordering anything matching what I was seeing. Upon further investigation, I discovered it was the Play Pretend brand of under eye cream. Yes, the Amazon product page does state the the cream comes in a syringe-like tube, and yes, it does state that it comes with a skincare travel bag, this wasn’t what I had envisioned.
On to the product…
Once I figured out how to open and operate the syringe (hint: remove the large, clear cap, remove the white tip, turn the plunger to unlock) to dispense the under eye cream, I applied some to my face. The scent is strong, like cucumber with an underlying perfume smell. Not unpleasant, but kind of strong for me, someone who is overly sensitive to scents. My problem, I know, and most people will probably really enjoy the scent. The cream is white, smooth, goes on evenly and is absorbed quickly. There is a bit of a cooling sensation which I found pleasant.

The travel bag seems unnecessary to me. It’s really not much more than a heavy ziplock bag lined with bubble wrap with a large logo reading “Skin Set Go.” If someone needs a bag, great, but I have several and I don’t think I’ll be using this one.

According to the company’s website, Skin Care Go products are made in the USA in small batches. Good. A lot of natural ingredients go into the product, which I like, but the complete list of ingredients from the company’s website is as follows:

Water (Aqua), Carthamus Tinctorius Seed Oil, Polyacrylate-13, Glycerin, Propylene Glycol, Polyisobutene, Squalane, Sodium Hyaluronate, Acetyl Hexapeptide-8, Cucumis Sativus (Cucumber) Fruit Extract, Retinyl Palmitate, Tocopherol, Palmitoyl Tripeptide-1, Palmitoyl Tetrapeptide-7, Butylene Glycol, Polysorbate 20, Acetyl Octapeptide-3, Caprylyl Glycol, Potassium Sorbate, Phenoxyethanol, Ethylhexylglycerin, Fragrance, Yellow 5 (CI 19140), Blue 1 (CI 42090).

The final verdict:
The product is nice, and while I’d personally prefer something less heavily scented, I like the way the cream works and what it does for my skin. It’s very hydrating and brightening, with nothing that irritated my skin. I understand the idea behind the syringe dispenser: it’s unique, it’s fun, it’s memorable. However, there’s a ton of plastic used that isn’t necessary, and with the design, I don’t know how I’ll know when the tube is nearing empty.
Overall, this is a good product, does what it says it does, and if you’re looking for something a little unusual, give it a try. Nice cream, gimmicky packaging KIMUSE Lash Enhancing Serum, Castor Oil, Eyelash Growth Serum and Eyebrow Enhancer, Promotes Appearance of Longer, Thicker Eyelashes, Fuller Thicker Lashes & Brows (5ML), Cruelty Free (lash enhancing serum) KIMUSE {'Use for': 'Face', 'Scent': 'Aloe', 'Brand': 'KIMUSE', 'Unit Count': '1.00 Count', 'Product Dimensions': '5.5 x 0.86 x 0.86 inches; 1.13 Ounces', 'UPC': '887349696800'} I’ve been trying out a couple of different lash serums over the past month. I have not noticed as significant an improvement in the thickness, or volume, of my lashes, however. I believe that these types of serums do help promote growth, and I haven't been able to detect much difference between brands except that a couple of them irritated my eyes. Therefore, my conclusion is that this is helpful and the real determination of what works best will be what's most comfortable for you to use, so read the ingredients and watch for any possible allergy triggers or irritants. Patience required
profile:
**User Summary:**

This user emphasizes comfort and relaxation in their self-care routines, now extending this philosophy to their exploration of lash and brow enhancement products. Their recent experience with a lash serum showcases their ongoing experimentation with different brands, reflecting a willingness to try new items while maintaining a focus on performance and comfort. They have shown a preference for products that are gentle and suitable for sensitive skin, confirming their commitment to avoiding irritants and opting for natural ingredients. Their positive response to the serum, despite a slow onset of noticeable results, exemplifies their patient and realistic approach to beauty products.

This user also maintains a growing awareness of sustainability, emphasizing functional and innovative packaging while expressing concerns about excessive plastic usage. They appreciate products that enhance their skincare and self-care rituals, balancing effectiveness with pleasant, low-irritant formulations. Sensitivity to strong scents continues to inform their choices, underscoring an understanding of individual preferences in skincare. Overall, they value items that promote relaxation, skin health, and practicality while remaining open to exploring new options that elevate their rituals and maintain a spa-like experience at home. Their experience with multiple products indicates a discerning yet adventurous attitude towards self-care, fostering ongoing improvements in their beauty routine.
